data.title: Here's the new cast of 'Mean Girls' posing with the stars of the 2004 movie
data.meta_description: While a couple of actors from the original film reprise their roles, the rest of the cast was overhauled for the new Gen Z take on the Plastics.
data.text:
This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

A remake of "Mean Girls" based on the 2004 film and the Broadway musical has been released.

A few actors from the original film reprise their roles. The rest of the cast was overhauled.

Here's a roundup of the original actors posing with their new counterparts.

A new "Mean Girls" movie based on the 2004 film and the Broadway musical landed in theaters on Friday.

The remake features Angourie Rice as Cady Heron, Reneé Rapp as Regina George, and Christopher Briney as Aaron Samuels. It follows the same overall plot as the 2004 movie that starred Lindsay Lohan but has been updated for a Gen Z audience in several ways.

This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

In a nod to the original, Tina Fey and Tim Meadows reprise their roles, while another star from the 2004 movie makes a surprise cameo.

Here are all the times the original actors from the 2004 version of "Mean Girls" have posed with their counterparts in the 2024 version.

Advertisement

Lindsay Lohan and Angourie Rice both played the protagonist, Cady.

Lohan played the "Mean Girls" protagonist in the 2004 movie, and Australian actor Angourie Rice takes the baton in the new iteration.

The two actors posed together on the pink carpet at the new version's New York premiere on January 8.

Advertisement

Amanda Seyfried played Karen in the original. In the remake, she's played by Avantika Vandanapu.

Seyfried played Karen Smith in the original. In the remake, she's renamed Karen Shetty and played by Vandanapu.

The two actors referenced one of the character's most memorable moments in an Instagram photo Seyfriend posted on Thursday.

Both actors posed with their hands on their chests, evoking the ditzy character's claim that her breasts can tell when it's raining.

"Karen meet Karen," Seyfried captioned the photo, while Vandanapu's caption read: "mother is a karen. @mingey."

Advertisement

Jaquel Spivey stepped into the role of Damien, who was played to perfection by Daniel Franzese.

Daniel Franzese previously played Janis' best friend, Damian (Lizzy Caplan portrayed Janis in the 2004 film, and Auli'i Carvalho plays the character in the new film), but Tony nominee Jaquel Spivey portrays him in the 2024 remake.

The two posed with their arms around each other on the red carpet at the movie's premiere.
